title: Dig Deep
description: An isometric pico-8 game about digging and family history for the Classic Collards Game Jam.

title: Avipaper.p8
description: A Pico-8 demo. Fly a paper airplane through some targets.

title: Bman3D
description: Modeled, textured, and rigged a 3D model of Bomberman from "Bomberman 64: the Second Attack!"

title: Scrapewood
description: Wrote a web-scraper to grab all of the main Achewood comics from the website. I then merged them into a unified PDF so that I could read them on my e-reader. Source not available because web scrappers always feel like they"re in dubiously legal territory and I don"t intend to distribute the resulting PDF or web scraper source.

title: Lost-n-found
description: A quick puzzle game for GGJ21 that I never properly named. The theme was "lost and found". The core idea I tried to execute on was a "hot or cold" style guessing game where you reveal clues which guide you toward finding some goal.

title: Wasteland Cracker
description: A clone of the Fallout hacking mini-game with an included tool for solving real puzzles

title: Tetrust
description: A TUI tetris clone written in rust

title: WSR Image Extractor
description: A tool to extract the images captured in a Windows Steps Recorder file

title: The Treachery of Self-image
description: A silly joke that I took too far and spent too much time on. The result? a parody of "the Treachery of Images" by Rene Magritte. In a funny turn of events, I like how it turned out.

title: Tinyrenderer
description: A cpu-based, didactic renderer project from Dmitry V. Sokolov's Tiny Renderer project.

title: Squid Mantazord
description: A top-down 2D gauntlet of sea-creatures to take the throne and become the next Squid Mantazord. Made for Global Game Jam 2017.

title: Monkey Muck
description: Designed, modeled, and textured an original 3D character. This character was inspired by horrific figures from franchises like Silent Hill, the Legend of Zelda, and the Thing.

title: Pixitor
description: A layer-based pixel art editor built using MIT"s Processing

title: Ogre JRPG
description: A turn-based battle system demo using Ogre3D for one of my university courses.

title: Labyrinth
description: A game with procedurally generated maps, and a lighting effect where only a certain radius of the map away from the character is lit (a torch effect). Built for the 2015 Fall GameJam at UT Austin.

title: Menger Sponge
description: An OpenGL menger sponge that can be fully rotated and have the level of recursion updated on the fly via popup menus
